This is the discussion thread for an article on GTPlanet:

Forza Motorsport Wins Two Categories at The Game Awards, But Gran Turismo Misses Out​

Forza Motorsport has come away from The Game Awards 2023 with two trophies for Innovation in Accessibility and Best Sports/Racing Game, while the Gran Turismo series missed out in both the categories for which it was nominated...

Joey D

47,082

Boyne Falls, MI

GTP_Joey

GTP Joey

Dec 8, 2023

#2

I agree with the accessibility since that's something Forza does very well, but is it the best sports/racing game? Eh, I'm not so sure about that. It's also pretty stupid that the Game Awards combines the two since they're both pretty different genres and enough games come out every year that would fill categories for separate awards. I mean, between 2K and EA, they put out enough sports games to fill the category every year and there are still a few one-offs that could supplement it. Racing, at the very least, has an F1, rally, and MotoGP game that fit in with the occasional cart racer.

Shame about the GT movie too, I thought it was rather good, but I do understand how The Last of Us beat it out.

Just in case anyone thinks I'm exaggerating about the 18 seconds, here's the entire segment for the category, cued up:

That's it. That's the whole thing.

It's also pretty stupid that the Game Awards combines the two

Fun fact: only one game that doesn't have cars in it and could only possibly be classed as sports has ever won this award...

... and that was based on four-wheeled motion too: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1+2 in 2020. Every other one of the nine winners has been a car or kart game - MK8, Rocket League, FH3, FM7, FH4, CTR Nitro, FH5, GT7, and now FM2023...

Dec 8, 2023

#4

About Best Sports/Racing Game, I don't even get why almost every nominee was a racing game this year. It would be better of separating the Sports and Racing Game into two separate categories if it keeps acting like that. Even the previous years' nominees were equally spread out, spread across other fields of sport like basketball, skateboarding, etc.

Plus, what about Ride 5, F1 Manager 23, Lego 2K Drive, MotoGP 23, and EA Sports WRC as possible nominees? I'm surprised that ACC didn't get nominated for Best Sports/Racing Game in its release year.

Hopefully, next year, TGA's board would at least care about true sim racing games like GTR Revival, Assetto Corsa 2 and Rennsport instead of slapping arcade racers in a sports-themed category.

As far as I'm aware, this Award show has never had the hardcore PC Sims (probably due to then being even more niche in an already niche category) so they just instead have the well known titles or the usual licensed yearly titles (which is probably the reason "Sports/Racing" is just hastily slapped together). Then again, the likes of Kunos and other predominantly PC heavy Sim developers don't tend to move around or promote nealy as much product as a first party name like Sony or Microsoft and third-party names like Epic, EA and Ubisoft.
